CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. bithiophene
2. imide
3. homopolymer
4. n-channel OFET (N-channel Organic Field-Effect Transistor)
5. vacuum
6. V th (voltage threshold)

Please let me know if you need further clarification or if there are any other entities you would like me to identify.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. bithiophene
2. imide
3. homopolymer

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| bithiophene |
| imide |
| homopolymer |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. μe (mu-e): This is a measure of the electrical conductivity of the n-channel OFET, represented by the Greek letter mu (μ). The subscript "e" indicates that it is the electrical conductivity.
2. Ion/Ioff: This is a measure of the ratio of the drain current (Ion) to the off-state current (Ioff) of the OFET.
3. Vth (V-th): This is the threshold voltage of the OFET, represented by the letter V-th.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions or if you'd like me to identify any other entities in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material properties:

1. μe (mu-e): This is a measure of the electrical conductivity of the n-channel OFET, represented by the Greek letter mu (μ).
2. Vth (V-th): This is the threshold voltage of the OFET.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |

| Vth (V-th) |

Paragraph: reported that n-channel OFET based on a bithiophene imide homopolymer exhibited a μ e of 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , I on / I off of 2 x 10^7 , and a high V th ( 75 V ) in vacuum after annealing process at 240 ° C. 27 The fused - ring system can maximize the π-orbital overlap by restricting intramolecular rotation in the oligomer and possibly to induce face - to - face π-stacking , facilitating charge transport through intermolecular hopping.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! To identify the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph, we can follow these steps:

1. Identify the entities that are being measured or observed in the paragraph. These are the properties that we are interested in.
2. Identify the entities that are being referred to in the paragraph. These are the objects or concepts that are being described or discussed.

Based on these steps, we can identify the following "Property Value" entities in the paragraph:

1. Property Value: μe (electrical conductivity)
Entities: n-channel OFET (the device being described), bithiophene imide homopolymer (the material used in the device)
Value: 1.1 x 10^-2 cm^2 V-1 s^-1 (the electrical conductivity of the device)
2. Property Value: Ion / Ioff (current-voltage characteristic)
Entities: n-channel OFET (the device being described), bithiophene imide homopolymer (the material used in the device)
Value: 2 x 10^7 (the current-voltage characteristic of the device)
3. Property Value: Vth (threshold voltage)
Entities: n-channel OFET (the device being described), bithiophene imide homopolymer (the material used in the device)
Value: 75 V (the threshold voltage of the device)
4. Property Value: fused-ring system (structural feature of the material)
Entities: bithiophene imide homopolymer (the material used in the device)
Value: fused-ring system (the structural feature of the material)

So, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. μe (electrical conductivity)
2. Ion / Ioff (current-voltage characteristic)
3. Vth (threshold voltage)
4. fused-ring system (structural feature of the material)
